item.title: Leaves … no clearing, 3rd November
item.description:
As seems to be the annual problem in Kings Hall Road the leaf clearance is being left for a one of end of season clear up. This is not good enough and we don’t want a repeat of last year where pedestrians and wheelchair users have to use the centre of the road to walk because the pavements are perilous. Last autumn we had to help a young mother dig her pushchair out of the leaves which were totally clogging the wheels. I feel certain that our council tax payments cover regular leaf and rubbish clearance that should occur more than once every three months. Residents are having to use their own paid for garden waste bins to go out and clear leaves from the pavements. Please rectify this issue and see that it is dealt with on an ongoing basis.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree prining required, 3rd November
item.description:
I have previously spoken to the council about pruning this tree and they recommended a request be put in after the summer so there is less weight on the branches. We have had several large branches snap off onto our property damaging vehicles. We have several elderly residents and their safety is important. The branches are also hanging onto the pavement, affecting walking up. We have significantly cleared the pavement of leaves and branches in anticipation of pruning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
